result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Steven M. Cohen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Prior: 30 W. Mifflin St. Ste 404, Madison, WI 53703-2558 United States
Defendant states the Deferred Prosecution Agreement has been completed, requests the Court review the case

Defendant, Steven M. Cohen, appeared pro se.  Albert D. Moustakis, Vilas County DA, appeared telephonically for the State of Wisconsin, as special prosecutor.  Bret Hammermeister appeard for probation. Court addressed agent regarding unpaid financials, stated $42.19 owed yet, plus additional processing fee totaling $44.30. Defendant stated he paid exactly what agent had told him was remaining. DA requested the Court waive the additional money owed, stated defendant did well on probation. Court called it even, defendant does not owe the $42.19.

records.addlTxt: filed by Court Reporter Marjorie Kurtz, Nov. 14, 2014 sentencing hearing

The matter is referred to the Office of Lawyer Regulation (OLR) pursuant to SCR 22.01.  The OLR shall move the court if it seeks to have it exercise its summary license suspension authority under SCR 22.20.
Defendant requests jail start time be changed - faxed
Deferred Entry of Judgment filed.
filed by Atty. Westmont
filed by Atty. Westmont

Defendant Steven M. Cohen in court with attorney Ruth N. Westmont.  Albert D. Moustakis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Reading waived on Amended Information. Court went over the rights & elements. Defendant plead no contest to counts 1,2,3. Court found defendant guilty on all counts. Entry of judgement withheld on ct. 1, Deferred Entry of Judgment Agreement approved by the Court. Count one held open for 5 yrs. Court found defendant guilty, entered judgment, withheld sentence on cts. 2&3, placed defendant on 2 yrs. probation, conditions: counseling as required by agent, $443 costs on each count. Court imposed 60 days jail, start  1/7/15 at 7 p.m. Huber granted under jail rules, may transfer sentence to Dane Cty. jail. Electronic monitoring granted. Court granted 1 day jail credit. Case called 9:10 a.m., Court adjourned 10:42 a.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 14, 2014 at 09:00 am.
from Atty Westmond requesting Aug. 8, 2014 plea/sentencing hearing be reset to November
Atty. Moustakis does not object to plea/sentencing being reset - fax
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 8, 2014 at 11:00 am.
Status conference on June 2, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
from DA Al Moustakis to confirm hearing for 4-11-14 has been rescheduled to 6/2/14 at 1:00 pm.

Defendant Steven M. Cohen in court with attorney Ruth N Westmont.  Albert D Moustakis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  $2000.00 signature bond, information filed.  Standard felony conditions, waives time limits.  May travel out of state. If visiting a client in jail or prison, must first provide a list of items in advance that he will be taking with, excluding confidential items.

Hearing on April 11, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

Special Prosecutor Albert Moustakis present for the State, Defendant present with Atty Ruth Westmont. Bond discussed. State notes that a detailed list of what Atty Cohen takes into the prison needs to be provided to the institution visiting. Waiver of Preliminary Hearing filed. Rights to preliminary hearing recited to the defendant. Court found waiver made freely, voluntarily and knowingly. Court found probable cause, bound defendant over. Information filed, reading waived. Defendant stood mute. Court entered not guilty plea.
